org.jamesframework.core.search.algo

Class BasicParallelSearch<SolutionType extends Solution>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jamesframework.core.search.Search<SolutionType>
      • org.jamesframework.core.search.algo.BasicParallelSearch<SolutionType>
  • Type Parameters:
    SolutionType - solution type of the problems that may be solved using this search, required to extend Solution
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class BasicParallelSearch<SolutionType extends Solution>
extends Search<SolutionType>

    A basic parallel search runs several (heterogeneous) searches in parallel and keeps track of the best solution found by any of these searches. The parallel search consists of a single step in which (1) all subsearches are executed concurrently using a cached thread pool, (2) the main search waits until termination of all subsearches and (3) the main search itself terminates.

    When a parallel search is requested to stop (see Search.stop()) it will propagate this request to its subsearches and will wait for their termination. Similarly, when a parallel search is disposed (see Search.dispose()) all subsearches are also disposed.

    Because searches are executed in separate threads, it is important to ensure that any shared objects (problem, objective, constraints, neighbourhood, ...) are thread-safe.

    Author:
    Herman De Beukelaer

    • Constructor Detail

      • BasicParallelSearch

        public BasicParallelSearch(Problem<SolutionType> problem)
        Creates a new basic parallel search, specifying the problem to solve. The problem can not be null. The default search name "BasicParallelSearch" is assigned to this search.
        Parameters:
        problem - problem to solve
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if problem is null

      • BasicParallelSearch

        public BasicParallelSearch(String name,
                           Problem<SolutionType> problem)
        Creates a new basic parallel search, specifying the problem to solve and a custom search name. The problem can not be null. The search name can be null in which case the default name "BasicParallelSearch" is assigned.
        Parameters:
        problem - problem to solve
        name - custom search name
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if problem is null

    • Method Detail

      • addSearch

        public void addSearch(Search<SolutionType> search)

        Add the given search, to be executed in parallel with the other searches. Only searches that solve the same problem as the one specified when creating the parallel search can be added. An exception will be thrown when attempting to add a search that solves a different problem. Note that this method may only be called when the search is idle.

        Because searches are executed in separate threads, it is important to ensure that any shared objects (problem, objective, constraints, neighbourhood, ...) are thread-safe.

        Parameters:
        search - search to add for parallel execution
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the parallel search is not idle, or if the given search does not solve the same problem as the parallel search

      • removeSearch

        public boolean removeSearch(Search<SolutionType> search)
        Remove the given search. If the search was never added, false is returned. Note that this method may only be called when the search is idle.
        Parameters:
        search - search to be removed from parallel algorithm
        Returns:
        true if search is successfully removed
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the search is not idle

      • getSearches

        public List<Search<SolutionType>> getSearches()
        Get a list of all searches that have been added to this parallel search for concurrent execution.
        Returns:
        list of all contained searches

      • searchStarted

        protected void searchStarted()
        When the search is started, it is verified whether at least one subsearch has been added. If not, an exception is thrown.
        Overrides:
        searchStarted in class Search<SolutionType extends Solution>
        Throws:
        SearchException - if no searches have been added

      • stop

        public void stop()
        When requesting to stop a basic parallel search, this request is propagated to each contained search.
        Overrides:
        stop in class Search<SolutionType extends Solution>

      • searchDisposed

        protected void searchDisposed()
        When disposing a basic parallel search, each of the searches that have been added to the parallel algorithm are disposed and the thread pool used for concurrent search execution is released.
        Overrides:
        searchDisposed in class Search<SolutionType extends Solution>

      • searchStep

        protected void searchStep()
        This algorithm consists of a single search step only, in which (1) the contained subsearches are executed in parallel, (2) the main search waits until they terminate and (3) the main search stops. A subsearch may terminate because it has come to its natural end, because it has active stop criteria or because the main search was requested to stop and propagated this request to the subsearches.
        Specified by:
        searchStep in class Search<SolutionType extends Solution>
